parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and the middle voice of aiteo; to beg off, i.e. Deprecate, decline, shun.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To flee out, away, escape; with an acc: I escape something. From ek and pheugo; to flee out.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and the middle voice of aiteo; to beg off, i.e. Deprecate, decline, shun.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From chrema; to utter an oracle, i.e. Divinely intimate; by implication, to constitute a firm for business, i.e. bear as a title.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
Much, many; often.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To turn away, pervert, remove; I restore, replace; mid: I desert, reject. From apo and strepho; to turn away or back.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
